name: GuestReady
slogan: Technology enabled Airbnb and short-term rental management
description:
GuestReady takes the hassle out of short-term and vacation rentals. From managing listings on websites, to optimizing the pricing strategy and online guest communication, all the way to checking guests in or out of the property and housekeeping after their departure.

We bring hotel standards to airbnb properties.

GuestReady stands for superior service, exclusive products, and a personal touch. 

The startup operates in Europe and Asia and has delighted hundreds of hosts and thousands of guests since its launch in 2016.

team.name: Bertrand Desies
team.bioHtml:
Co-founder and Managing Director at GuestReady

(Ex-Rocket Internet Country Manager)

team.name: Alexander Limpert
team.bioHtml: Co-Founder and CEO at GuestReady previously MD at Rocket Internet owned food delivery company Foodpanda

jobs.title: City Lead - Bristol
jobs.description:
GuestReady is a startup in the sharing economy, building on the success of short-term rental companies. It’s mission is to take the hassle out of short-term rentals, any operations that are related to turning over guests and optimize listings to incur a maximum yield for the host are handled by GuestReady. The company is co-founded by seasoned entrepreneurs (some former Ex-Rocket Internet executives) in Europe and Asia.

If you are keen to learn more, feel free to read up on us, for example in TechCrunch, Forbes, or simply get in touch with us via steffan.maagefelt@guestready.com

Responsibilities (non-concluding):
- Establish GuestReady in Bristol
- Build strong relationships to property owners
- Build a portfolio of premium homes
- Adapt GuestReady’s global best practices to the local requirements
- Be in charge of optimizing operational processes (housekeeping, linen, check-in/check-out)
- Assist in recruiting, training, and developing a stellar team
- Develop strategy, tactics, and sales plans to achieve expected sale targets
- Develop relationships and negotiate contracts with hosts and real estate agents
- Educate potential customers to the benefits of GuestReady
- Identify and reporting on business opportunities in target markets
- Represent the company at conferences, trade fairs and networking events
- Identifying service improvements or new service by remaining current on industry trends, market activities and competitors

Requirements:
- Able to work in Bristol with a good knowledge of the city
- Fluent in writing and speaking in English
- Strong analytical skills, identify gaps/opportunities
- A people person, comfortable interacting with casual hosts and ultra high end professional alike
- Self-driven, self-motivated, proactive - a hustler!
- Risk taker, outspoken and extroverted
- Detail oriented, strong focus on quality
- Ability to prioritize and structure problems
- Willingness to go the extra mile
- Strong analytical skills, identify gaps/opportunities
- Experience in operations, hospitality, property management, or similar field a plus

Offer:
- Competitive Compensation
- Ground floor opportunity to build a funded startup from scratch
- Casual dress code
- A dynamic work environment with flat hierarchies and space for your own ideas
- Diverse tasks which will let you grow day by day

jobs.title: Sales Associate - London
jobs.description:
GuestReady is a startup in the sharing economy, building on the success of short-term rental companies. It’s mission is to take the hassle out of short-term rentals - any operations that are related to turning over guests and optimize listings to incur a maximum yield for the host are handled by GuestReady. The company is co-founded by seasoned entrepreneurs (some former Ex-Rocket Internet executives) in Europe and Asia.

Responsibilities (non-concluding):

- Develop strategy, tactics, sales plans to achieve expected sale targets
- Develop relationships and negotiate contracts with hosts and real estate agents
- Educate potential customers to the benefits of GuestReady
- Identify and reporting on business opportunities in target markets
- Research and analyze sales options
- Represent the company at conferences, trade fairs and networking events
- Identifying service improvements or new service by remaining current on industry trends, market activities and competitors

Requirements:

- Able to work in London
- Fluent in writing / speaking in English
- Strong analytical skills, identify gaps/opportunities
- A people person, comfortable interacting with casual hosts and ultra high end professional alike
- Self-driven, self-motivated, proactive - a hustler!
- Risk taker, outspoken and extroverted
- Detail oriented, strong focus on quality
- Ability to prioritize and structure problems
- Willingness to go the extra mile
- Strong analytical skills, identify gaps/opportunities

Offer:

- Compensation: competitive salary plus travel expenses
- Casual dress code
- Ground floor opportunity to build a funded startup from scratch
- A dynamic work environment with flat hierarchies and space for your own ideas
- Diverse tasks which will let you grow day by day
